intro: Hutchinsia alba var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth white hutchinsia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in a fine, silky texture. This variant is distinguished by its smooth, glabrous surface, which sets it apart from other varieties within the species.
